Activates when asked to "write docs", "document this", "create README", "update documentation", or similar requests. Analyzes code/templates to extract information and writes clear, user-focused documentation following project style.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution or network access. Standard documentation tool capabilities (file read/write, command testing) match stated purpose. No suspicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: This skill helps developers create clear documentation for Logseq Template Graph. It generates module READMEs, user guides, technical references, and API documentation by analyzing source code and templates.
actual_capabilities: Generate module READMEs from source code and templates
Create user guides with step-by-step instructions
Analyze code to extract key information
limitations: Limited to Logseq Template Graph project documentation
Does not generate documentation for other projects
Requires existing source files to analyze
Cannot test on systems without required tools

use_cases.title: Document new modules
use_cases.description: Generate READMEs for new modules by analyzing classes, properties, and their relationships in the source directory.

use_cases.title: Create user guides
use_cases.description: Write step-by-step guides for features, installation, and workflows that help users get started quickly.

use_cases.title: Document scripts and APIs
use_cases.description: Create API references for build scripts, export tools, and command-line interfaces with examples.

prompt_templates.title: Document new module
prompt_templates.scenario: Create documentation for a new module
prompt_templates.prompt: Document the [module-name] module. Read the source files and generate a comprehensive README with classes, properties, usage examples, and Schema.org references.

prompt_templates.title: Update installation guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the installation guide with new steps for [tool or feature]. Read the existing guide and add accurate, tested instructions.

prompt_templates.title: Write API docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Document the [script-name] script. Analyze the code and create an API reference with parameters, options, examples, and exit codes.

prompt_templates.title: Create feature guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a user guide for the [feature-name] feature. Include what it does, when to use it, step-by-step instructions, examples, and troubleshooting tips.

output:
# Person Module

The Person module provides classes for tracking individuals including their personal information, professional details, and relationships.

## Classes

**Person** - Represents a human being
- Parent: Thing
- Properties: 36 properties
- Use for: Tracking contacts, team members, and individuals

**Patient** - Person receiving medical care
- Parent: Person
- Properties: Medical-related properties
- Use for: Healthcare and medical contexts

## Properties

**email** (URL, :one) - Email address
- Used by: Person, Organization
- Example: "user@example.com"

**jobTitle** (Text, :one) - Job title
- Used by: Person
- Example: "Senior Engineer"

## Usage Examples

### Track a contact
Add a person page with name, email, and phone properties.

### Manage team members
Create person entries with job title, works for organization, and team relationships.

best_practices: Test all commands and code examples before documenting them
Use concrete examples instead of placeholders whenever possible
Link to related documentation and keep references current
anti_patterns: Using placeholders instead of real, tested examples

faq.question: What types of documentation can this skill create?
faq.answer: Module READMEs, user guides, technical references, API documentation for scripts and commands, and feature documentation.

faq.question: What project formats are supported?
faq.answer: Designed for Logseq Template Graph which uses EDN format for templates and Markdown for documentation files.

faq.question: Can this skill document any code file?
faq.answer: It works best with Logseq Template Graph files. For other projects, it can read source files but may not follow optimal structure.

faq.question: Does this skill store or transmit my data?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that generates documentation using standard Claude Code tools locally.

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: Read, Write, Edit, Grep, Glob, and Bash tools to analyze files and generate accurate documentation.

faq.question: How does this compare to other documentation tools?
faq.answer: Unlike automated tools like JSDoc or Sphinx, this skill creates human-readable guides tailored to specific audiences and use cases.
